parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.02</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Changes the mass of a PhysX object. When using the alternative syntax the mass change is gradual during the given time. A time of zero means immediate change.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> When main syntax is used on [[local]] vehicle, the change is global. When alternative syntax is used with time transition on [[local]] vehicle, the gradual mass change doesn't happen on remote clients, only final mass is applied after the given time. If you need gradual change on remote clients too, [[remoteExec | remote execute]] [[setMass]] globally. </value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> myObject [[setMass]] mass </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  myObject: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value>  mass: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> myObject [[setMass]] [mass, time] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value>  myObject: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value>  mass: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value>  time: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setMass]] [10, 0.5];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setMass]] 10;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getMass]], [[setCenterOfMass]], [[getCenterOfMass]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 20 Jun, 2014 - 12:50
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]
<dd class="note">
(ArmA3 1.22) A quick reference:
{| class="wikitable sortable"

! category
! [[setMass]]
! [[setCenterOfMass]]

|-
| unit
| The larger the mass is, the easier a unit will physically fatigued
| N/A

|-
| aircraft
| The larger the mass is, the more sensitive an aircraft will react to joystick, vice versa (Except when AFM is enabled).
| Aircraft slant due to center change accordingly, and the position of the camera view will be altered relatively at the same time. (3rd person view)

|-
| vehicle
| The larger the mass is, the slower a vehicle drives (Ships will sink), vice versa. (Land vehicle performs like a bouncing ball while ships accelerated pretty speedy.)
| Vehicle slant due to center change accordingly.

|}
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 26, 2015 - 15:02 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:N3croo|N3croo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If you intend to use setMass in conjunction with ropeCreate in MP i highly recommend to first ropeCreate then setMass (on clientside).
RopeCreate in MP will set the mass of the attached object to the server value upon execution.
</dd>
</dl>
